casebody.data:
CONSTITUTIONAL COURT,

COLUMBIA,

APRIL, 1802. Lide v. Reynolds.

In this case, the statute of limitations was pleaded in bar to a claim of dower, and upon a motion in this court, was held to be a good plea. See Bac. Abr. Dower. F. 2 Rep. 93. 10 Rep. 49, 99. 3 Inst. 216. Hob. 265. Moore, 879. Dyer, 224. Plowd. 373, 515. [Mitchell v. Poyas, 1 N. and M. 85. Ramsay v. Dozier, Treadw. 112.]
